info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 7:39PM CDT until April 01 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN OGLE AND DE KALB COUNTIES... At 738 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms capable of producing tornadoes were located along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Davis Junction to near Waterman to near Leland, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. These dangerous storms will be near... DeKalb and Sandwich around 745 PM CDT. Sycamore, Cortland, Hinckley, Maple Park and Kingston around 750 PM CDT. Genoa around 755 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these tornadic storms include Creston. This includes... Northern Illinois University and Sandwich Fairgrounds. Including the following interstates... I-39 between mile markers 104 and 107. I-88 between mile markers 82 and 101. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
